intro: Xylopia trichostemon, commonly known as the African bitter apple, is a flowering plant belonging to the Anacardiaceae family. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. Xylopia trichostemon is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and ethnobotanical studies.
